recordTypes.name: Soil Erosion Permit
recordTypes.description:
THE SOIL EROSION PERMIT IS INCLUDED WITH THE BUILDING PERMIT. IF YOU INTEND TO FILL OUT A BUILDING PERMIT THEN DO NOT FILL THIS INDIVIDUAL SOIL EROSION PERMIT OUT.

This permit is required for any individual, corporation, or organization proposing a development project that involves the disturbance of natural terrain, in accordance with the soil erosion ordinance. The permit ensures that all necessary precautions are taken to minimize soil erosion, protect water quality, and prevent environmental degradation during construction or land development activities.

Applicants must provide details of the proposed project, including the site location, scope of work, and any measures planned to control soil erosion. The permit is essential for compliance with local environmental regulations and must be obtained prior to beginning any land disturbance activities.

recordTypes.name: Sewer Permit
recordTypes.description: A Sewer Service Connection Permit is required for any connections to the Townâ€™s sewer system. This  includes the connection of a new sewer line to an existing line, modifications, repairs, and disconnections, even if it is on private property.

recordTypes.name: Building Permit
recordTypes.description:
NOTICE: Combination Sign permits and combination Swimming Pool permits are now available - so separate building and wire permits are no longer necessary.

Apply here for a building permit from the Town of Smithfield, and (if applicable) apply for a related Fire Plan Review from the Fire Marshal. Tent only projects are applied for under the Fire Marshall page. These permits may be for all structures including pools, decks, houses, commercial buildings, etc.

recordTypes.name: NEW Life Safety Inspection
recordTypes.description: Click here to submit your request for an inspection from the Office of the State Fire Marshal (related to business licenses or construction rough/final)

recordTypes.name: Electrical Permit
recordTypes.description:
Apply here for an electrical permit from the Town of Smithfield, and (if applicable) apply for a related Fire Plan Review from the Fire Marshal. Energy storage systems unrelated to photovoltaic systems may be applied for here as well.
NOTICE: All applications, designs, and wire work, as of May 1, 2022, shall be in accordance with NFPA 70, 70E 2020 edition; NFPA 72 2019 edition.
NOTICE: There is a Sign Permit available - so separate wire and building permits are no longer necessary.

recordTypes.name: Dog Park Membership
recordTypes.description: Please fill out this form to apply for a Smithfield Dog Park Membership Card.

recordTypes.name: Mechanical Permit
recordTypes.description:
Apply here for a mechanical permit from the Town of Smithfield, and (if applicable) also apply here for a related Fire Plan Review from the Fire Marshal. This permit is for all HVAC, similar mechanical systems and automatic fire suppression systems. This permit is also for air movement systems, boiler, pressure vessel, refrigeration, and fossil fuel fired appliances and storage tanks. Water based heating systems including solar systems and radiant flooring area also under this permit. 
NOTICE: All applications, designs, and mechanical work, as of May 1, 2022, shall be in accordance with SBC-4  International Mechanical Code, amended 2018 edition; SBC-19 International Fuel Gas Code, amended 2018 edition; NFPA 13, 13R, and 13D amended 2016 edition.

recordTypes.name: Plumbing Permit
recordTypes.description:
Apply here for a plumbing permit from the Town of Smithfield, and (if applicable) apply for a related Fire Plan Review from the Fire Marshal.
NOTICE: All applications, designs, and plumbing work, as of May 1, 2022, shall be in accordance with SBC-3  International Plumbing Code, amended 2018 edition.

recordTypes.name: Swimming Pool and Spa Permit
recordTypes.description:
This is a combination permit that allows for NEW INSTALLATIONS of in-ground and above ground pools, public and privately owned. This combination permit is for pools without and with electrical connections so your electrician doesn't have to pull a separate wire permit.  
Pools with heating sources other than electric shall require a separate fuel gas or mechanical permit. Existing pools needing new wiring shall require individual (separate) wire permits.

recordTypes.name: Sign Permit
recordTypes.description: Apply for a sign permit from the Town of Smithfield. This permit allows a single application for both electrified and non-electrified signs. All permit applications should include photos of any existing signage.

recordTypes.name: Solar Permit
recordTypes.description: Apply for a solar permit from the Town of Smithfield.

recordTypes.name: Demolition Permit (Complete demolition/raze of structure).
recordTypes.description:
Apply for a demolition permit from the Town of Smithfield.
Partial demolition and exploratory demolition can be done through building permit application.

recordTypes.name: School or Nursery Inspection - Annual
recordTypes.description: Annual inspection report for public and private places of education (k-12), also public and private nurseries. See RISBC-13; 510-RICR-00-00-13.

recordTypes.name: Compliance Inspection - Annual
recordTypes.description: Apply to request Compliance Inspection to satisfy licensing requirements. Please note this application will need to be made annually to request inspection and required letter of compliance.

recordTypes.name: Temporary Outside Dining
recordTypes.description: Temporary outside dining permit only. This permit is not for permanent rededication of outdoor space to patron seating or occupancy changes.
